alert.note: Alert for Marquette (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued March 18 at 4:48AM EDT until March 18 at 8:00PM EDT by NWS Marquette
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Moderate to heavy lake effect snow showers expected. Heaviest snow showers expected through noon EDT today. Additional snow accumulations of 3 to 8 inches, locally up to 10 inches in the higher terrain west of Big Bay to Negaunee, Ishpeming, and Skandia. Less than 2 inches is expected across far southern and southwestern Marquette County. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph, especially close to Lake Superior, leading to blowing snow. Expect the strongest winds and most significant blowing snow to occur mid morning through this afternoon. * WHERE...Marquette County. * WHEN...Until 8 PM EDT this evening. * IMPACTS...Travel will become difficult in some areas. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. Highway M-28 east of Harvey could become especially impacted by blowing snow and low visibility from mid morning through this afternoon.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling.
